rev.comment: clarify youtube information; rm unsubstantiated statements.
rev.diff:
Line 64: Line 64:
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions).<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref> [[Google SketchUp]], a 3D CAD program, was also released in 2006, and was promoted as working with [[Google Earth]]. [[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] project hosting.
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions).<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref> [[Google SketchUp]], a 3D CAD program, was also released in 2006, and was promoted as working with [[Google Earth]]. [[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] project hosting.
â
On [[October 9]], [[2006]], Google announced that it would buy the popular online video site [[YouTube]] for [[United States Dollar|$]]1.65 billion.<ref>La Monica, Paul R. "[http://money.cnn.com/2006/10/09/technology/googleyoutube_deal/index.htm?cnn=yes Google to buy YouTube for $1.65 billion]." ''[[CNN]].'' [[October 9]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 9]], [[2006]].</ref> The news came as a surprise to many news magazines which thought it to be a joke due to the fact that the Wall Street Journal credited a blog post for the initial scoop with the title "Completely Unsubstantiated Google/YouTube Rumor".
+
On [[October 9]], [[2006]], Google announced that it would buy the popular online video site [[YouTube]] for [[United States Dollar|$]]1.65 billion.<ref>La Monica, Paul R. "[http://money.cnn.com/2006/10/09/technology/googleyoutube_deal/index.htm?cnn=yes Google to buy YouTube for $1.65 billion]." ''[[CNN]].'' [[October 9]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 9]], [[2006]].</ref> The brand, ''YouTube,'' will continue to exist, and will not merge with [[Google Video]]. Meanwhile, Google Video signed an agreement with [[Sony BMG Music Entertainment]] and the [[Warner Music Group]], for both companies to deliver music videos to the site.<ref> Staff Writer. "[http://www.side-line.com/news_comments.php?id=17747_0_2_0_C Google buys YouTube]." ''[[Side-Line Magazine]].'' [[October 9]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 9]], [[2006]].</ref>
â   â
The brand YouTube will continue to exist however and will not merge with GoogleVideo. The latter in the meantime signed an agreement with Sony BMG Music Entertainment and the Warner Music Group. Both companies will deliver music videos for the Google Video-site. It is yet to be announced how Google intends to take care of the potential huge copyright problems with the popular video-site. <ref>"[http://www.side-line.com/news_comments.php?id=17747_0_2_0_C Google buys YouTube]." ''[[Side-Line Magazine]].'' [[October 9]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 9]], [[2006]].</ref>
